description: Used to indicate temporal sequence or to list steps in order. Essential for narrating events or giving instructions.
usage: Typically used to connect events that happen one after another. Very useful when explaining a process or telling a story.

examples.french: D'abord, on mélange les ingrédients, ensuite on cuit pendant 30 minutes.
examples.english: First, we mix the ingredients, then we cook for 30 minutes.

examples.french: Je me lève à 7h, ensuite je prends mon petit-déjeuner.
examples.english: I wake up at 7am, then I have my breakfast.

examples.french: Nous avons visité le musée, ensuite nous sommes allés au restaurant.
examples.english: We visited the museum, then we went to the restaurant.

notes: Very common in everyday French. Essential for A1-A2 learners to organize their speech when describing sequences.
